Alex Proyas takes this concept and turns it into a Terminator-like film that turns out surprisingly good.Del Spooner (Will Smith) plays a detective that has a vendetta against robots in the year 2035 in Chicago. He despises robots, and one day he catches his break and finds a case that involves a robot. Dr. Alfred Lanning (James Cromwell), the creator of the robots and the three falls from his office window in what looks like a suicide. Spooner has a suspicion that it wasn't suicide, but that it could have been murder, and with the help of Dr. Susan Calvin (Bridget Moynahan) he reveals a deep mystery focused around a certain robot, and his capability to defy the three laws.Going into I, Robot, I was expecting an unstable plot with overdone CGI. What I got was a surprisingly pleasing plot with excellent CGI. It was so perfect that you almost couldn't tell it was CGI. It was probably the best CGI I have ever seen in a film. The film did share a lot of similar ideas with films such as The Terminator and The Matrix, but not enough where you can say the whole film was mimicking those films. The script was strong enough to hold on it's own without any unneeded side stories. A big plus was the relatively small cast with the script being based on the main idea rather than going into off into unneeded side-stories that would interfere an already complex story. Everything had a connection that concluded the story without a problem.Will Smith portrayed his character superbly. Sure, the acting could always be better, but he didn't have much of an impact to say that the whole movie revolved around him. It was a simple role, and Will Smith was perfect for the job. Although this wasn't a breakthrough role for Will Smith, it was one of his better movies as far as acting goes. Bridget Moynahan wasn't all that great, and the rest of the cast was adequate.The visuals were stunning. Patrick Tatopoulos, the production designer, built a realistic universe and Proyas made it visually outstanding. I would have never dreamed to see CGI be this good. It fit perfectly with how the movie flowed with the plot. You wouldn't be able to tell if it was CGI or not. Visually, everything was up-to-par with the recent standard sci-fi films, but I, Robot stood out with its awe-inspiring unique visualizes.I, Robot stands out as a very interesting film that made a new standard for visuals. I loved how the film used a concept such as Wal-Mart and independent stores with the idea of robots and humans. Wal-Mart is so cheap, so it forces independent stores to close if no one buys anything from the store, whereas in the movie robots take the place of human jobs because they do a better and faster job. That made the film feel more interested. I could say this movie would be in the top 3 movie roles that Will Smith played, and probably his best acting job. I, Robot offered action, amazing visuals, a delightful plot, a little bit of humor, with so-so acting, which adds up to a must-see film if your into the sci-fi genre, or if you just want to catch a enjoyable film.Story: B+ Acting: C+ Visuals: A+ Cinematography: B Overall: B+ (Not an average)

title: I, Loved It
content: This film is great, sorry, I mean LEGENDARY!! This is amongst the best movies made in 2004. The actors were superb, they did their job well. And the director, man, did he do a good job or WHAT?! A superb not-that-well-known director, Alex Proyas.Despite being Not-that-well-known, Alex Proyas has actually done three blockbuster hit movies (i.e. I, Robot, The Crow and Dark City, I haven't actually SEEN Dark City, but I've Heard that it was good). If Alex Proyas reads this review, I think he ought to know he did a great job.And if any big Hollywood producers by any chance get to read this review, I would strongly recommend Alex Proyas for your next movie. And I would strongly recommend any readers to save up your pocket money, go out and buy this film. This is a film worth being in every household. You will not regret buying this masterpiece of a movie.!!!!!!!BUY IT NOW!!!!!!!

title: Predictable and badly-made
content: The robots must have systematically worked through every previous movie script to ensure that you had seen every scene before in another film. Consequently the film creates a new record in cinema in not having a single original thing in it.But even if the plot was recycled, the execution was not any better. Perhaps I am getting used to impossible events being depicted by special effects, but I was never able to suspend disbelief. You knew you were looking at cartoons, and so it was not even good fun to watch.In the penultimate scene, there was even the standard murder-mystery line. After the hero has won, someone says "There is one thing that bothers me, how did you know that ...." The hero then explains how it worked it all out. Miss Marple, Perry Mason, Columbo and the others would have been proud. So after all that murder and mayhem, there was only one thing that bothered Susan Calvin?The thing that bothers me there is ample scope for a sequel along the lines of the Book of Exodus.

title: Flat and Uninteresting
content: This thing broke robot rule number one. Never injure a human being, through inaction or interaction. This thing was so bad that it hurt this human being. Stay away for your own mental heath. Just as bad as that other film written by this robot lovin' loser. 'Bicentennial Man' with Robin Williams may have had less action in it then this movie but even that crap wasn't as devoid of thought as I, Robot is.The robots never looked like they were actually real or interacting properly with the human cast. They never seemed like a real world threat. Even the mob fight and the police station attack seemed to have no real world threat.You could almost see the wires lifting the cops as the robots 'hit' them. This was a green screen film where you felt the actors looking at nothing as they tried to act. Maybe the humans were really the deficient ones. The effects department and the actors failed heremiserably.

title: Good idea
content: I think it's a very successful sci-fi with an interesting idea. I really liked the setting and the futuristic cars. Of course, they don't dazzle as much nowadays because times have moved on, but I was still quite impressed. The plot was also cool and I was waiting for the reveal, which I got. For me, a great film that I recommend.

title: Very good
content: If the measure of a good film is whether or not it has good acting, a good plot, good effects, good soundtrack and is well directed.We can also add the extent to which the movie meets its brief - an action movie should have action etc.If a film is based on a book or writing then we can add another criteria: the extent to which the movie reflects the tone, style and general content of that writing.On those criteria, this in my view, is a very good film.Will Smith is great. The other characters, including the robot, are touching. The sets and effects are stunning. The plot has a number of twists and turns, and the soundtrack reflects the period and the type of movie.Simply great.

title: clever, cool scifi-movie
content: Alex Proyas and Will Smith do a movie inspired by Isaac Asimov. That can only turn out as a typical flat summer blockbuster or something really cool beyond our imagination.In case of "I, Robot" I was a bit skeptic at first and finally nearly blown away by the result. This movie looks awesomely good, has fun moments, really shows a believable future and keeps you tight to your chair. We have the cool Will Smith as a robot-hating cop, a lovely Bridget Moynahan - a new face -, some really cool CGI-Stuff and some breathtaking camera-moves that rocks. And some things you might think about for some time. And even if you say, that we already see some of that before, you won't have seen that so well put together!"I, Robot" is one hell of a ride. That's how an enjoyable summer blockbuster must be like!

title: Everything you want, Sci Fi fan or not
content: We've heard the arguments that Proyas' film is not true Asimov. However, unless you're a die-hard purist, or just hate Will Smith in general, this movie has everything you could want in good sci-fi, action, summer movie, built for entertainment. The face-actors do a pretty good job carrying their part, Alan Tudyk comes across very well as Sonny, and the animation and effects of the robots themselves are top-notch. Sure, there's huge holes, and scenes where you will grimmace and say "why in the world did the director see the need to do that?!" But give me any recent film that doesn't have those in it? The good thing is that if you're not a Sci Fi fan, the story travels pretty well enough to drift you past the nerdy parts so you don't have to consider what "similacra" is. If you are a Sci Fi fan, there's certainly enough techno-fun to peak interests, and keep the action scenes from dominating the experience for you. The only thing it doesn't have is much of a love story. Oh well. The rest is pretty good. The eminent danger from the robots is forced pretty hard, and shoved down your throat, although not bad enough to trash the whole movie. That's the only real reason I'm NOT giving the movie a solid A+. Otherwise, I thoroughly enjoyed it, loved the job they did with Sonny, enjoyed the story, and yes I even HAVE read Asimov's book. Don't care that they're different. The premise remains, and that's enough for me. Good film, not tremendous, very enjoyable for both dummies and brainiacs. B+.

title: Mission: Okay
content: I, Robot is no bad movie but somewhat drowns in mediocrity - the story told, the characters, everything is well known, a kind of Terminator light, nothing that really will surprise you, sci-fi with a lot of dust orbiting. Anyway, watching I, Robot won't hurt you - recommended if you want a dose of Will Smith.

title: Better than I remembered
content: Intelligent Science Fiction seems to be an oxymoron in Hollywood (unless perhaps you are Christopher Nolan, and even there I am not convinced.) But this action blockbuster at least tries to bring some smarts to the genre even if it fails to progress much beyond cliché in the general characterisation. It's also a shame that Asimov's Robot stories haven't been mined more thoroughly either before or since (unlike PK Dick who seems to be eternal flavour of the month.) Indeed the central conceit of this particular screenplay should really have been in a sequel (or even later) since it relies on the audience properly understanding the implications of the Three Laws so that the logical conclusion which is drawn in the film has more of an impact in terms of what it really means. But Will Smith is as watchable as ever, and the effects still stand up pretty well today (7 years on) with the mass robot sequences working especially well. I was surprised how much I enjoyed it (even if the plot holes are all too apparent) and yes, I think it does qualify as Intelligent SF.

title: VERY FUTURISTIC INDEED
content: This is indeed an amazing Science fiction movie. Trust me when l say if you watch it to the end you will definitely fall in love with how it was concluded.If someone tells you this movie's storyline you will think it's an ordinary movie with nothing new to offer. After watching it you will discover that it is exciting and you won't regret the decision to do so.The movie has good twists, l especially loved watching where Sonny proves his faithfulness to humanity by helping Spooner and Calvin destroy the computer core with the Nanites which Calvin was supposed to use on Sonny.I give a 10 star rating.

title: 7/10 - Good for maybe 2-3 times
content: Review: Loosely based on Isaac Asimov's series (I say loosely VERY loosely here), this movie attempts to show us the dangerous side to AI. There are however annoying tidbits in the movie such as the constant bombardment of advertisement we are shown throughout the movie and the 'slapped together' nature of the ending (a typical "He did it", "She did it" scenario which is what were left deducing). Other than those small imperfections, it works out to be a great action flick good for Friday nights. Great CG effects (although not seat-gripping) and interesting Robot paradigm discussions heighten the viewers positive experience.7/10 - Good for maybe 2-3 times

title: Too familiar
content: This film, very loosely based on the Isaac Asimov book, has Will Smith as a police officer in the future trying to unravel the truth behind the death of a scientist who invented robotics (James Cromwell). A robot emerges as the prime suspect, something no one else will believe... and Smith winds up on the outs with his bosses... This is all pretty familiar material, owing more to "Blade Runner' and "RoboCop" than it does to the source material. Still, Smith is an engaging personality and the film has some fun action sequences, though the animation of the CG robots is very hit and miss. All in all though, its a very forgetable film that seems cobbled together from parts of other, better, movies. GRADE: C+

title: a comment/question on one of the most remembered quotes in the movie
content: This not only a comment, but also a question. in the previews of the movie I, Robot, Will Smith said "I'm gonna miss the good old days when people were killed by other people",but in the actual movie Chi McBride says "I'm gonna miss the good old days when people were killed by other people". I was just wondering was that just a default in the movie or were you guys doing it on purpose to see if anyone would catch it, because i saw the previews and that line caught my attention. So you could imagine the surprise i got when i saw the movie. I'm not down-rating the movie in any way, as a matter of fact i think you guys should change your rating scale because i give this movie a 20. Thanks for giving me the opportunity to comment on such a great movie. Chris p.s. will there be a part 2?

title: Good summer movie
content: Sction. Adventure. Things exploding. Light romance. Humor. Drama. All the ingredients for a good summer movie. And this is one of the best.I have to be honest, if this came out during non-summer months, it'd do well, sure, but probably not as well as it is now. I could be wrong, that's just what seems to be the trend with most sci-fi movies that I know of. But in no way do I consider myself an expert on this stuff.Acting is great - Will Smith gets some great one-liners, as usual. There are a few moments that give a sense of deja-vu (MIB, anyone?) but not many.I enjoyed this. And I think I may read the Assimov book it's based on, though I already know the two are bound to be different. It always happens with movies, that there are differences between them and the stories they are based on. Still, if a good movie leads to a good story, or vice versa, there's no harm done. I hope that's the case with I, Robot.

title: So. Easily. Watchable. Very entertaining.
content: I don't have a lot to say about this movie, all I really want to say is this:I, Robot is one of those movie that if I catch it on TV, no matter at what point in the movie, I will watch it to it's end.It is just so easily watchable. I don't know if English speaking people understand what I mean by that, but what I mean is that is doesn't require anything from the viewer. It visually interesting, got lots of eye candy, it's cut in a way that keeps it from being boring, it's well paced - and so on and so on. It is just very "easily watchable".It's action, very enjoyable action sequences, it's the future, technology. It's just really, really entertaining. Well made.

title: Film making by numbers
content: Having seen a few trailers for 'I, Robot' I made the informed decision to give it a miss. I was somewhat surprised to find a generally favourable critical response to the film, so decided to give it a chance. I must admit that I wish I'd stuck to my former decision. You need to be seriously into the sci-fi genre (or Will Smith) to really enjoy this film.Set 31 years in the future Chicago seems to have undergone a dramatic change. The city is inundated with robots which make humans more or less redundant. Although these robots are programmed to ensure they can never hurt humans we all know that this is not going to work. It seems that we must have become a much more trusting race during the next 31 years because only Spooner (Smith) seems to question whether the robots can break their 3 rules.The cast do their best, but it's a shame we couldn't lose a bit of Smith in favor of Cromwell. Even though it's got a few moments that will make you squirm a bit it isn't a bad film - it's just very average. 6/10

title: Smith at his best, with a explosive blockbuster.
content: I-ROBOT, arguably Will Smiths best movie! I-robot really hits the mark and is a big massive blockbuster, and very entertaining.Smith is at his very best. I-Robot boast on amazing visual, the effects were cool too.heres 3 points in why. 1)storyline: the storyline was spot on, and very original. the movie was well paned out and its always good to have a interesting plot along with some great action, again very unique plot. moving on 2)acting: Will Smith again shows tremendous talent and his acting was superb as you would expect and Smith in the movie made it that much better, without him in the movie maybe it wont be the same, the rest of the cast showed a good performance too. 3)action/thrill: Like i said there's always good to have a good plot in the movie but without action it will be dull. but again I-ROBOT is full with mind blowing action throughout and plenty of thrills. overall I-ROBOT hit it's mark, a great action popcorn flick, and Will Smith wont let you down.

title: Surprised
content: So, it's a big budget action film and all. It's not Gosford Park but then it's closer to that than other sci-fi treasures-become-film like Battlefield Earth.I don't think it's fair to review this movie without making note of the outrage expressed by the sci-fi fan base over the plot of this film. Apparently the film is pretty substantially different from the book. Having a beloved book taken from you and turned into a different movie is disappointing and usually a disaster.Now, to one who doesn't know the book: This is a good movie. It takes a number of ideas such as reliance on technology, racial prejudice, survivor's guilt and the nature of the soul and frames them in a high-tech big budget actioner. That's a good thing.There were a couple of scenes that I think show the problem of making this kind of movie in Hollywood. The big robots-jumping-on-the-Audi scene that made all the trailers and advertisements didn't need to be done so lavishly. It reminded me of the Death Star battle in Jedi where swarms of ships appear on screen at once. It was too much for me to appreciate visually. It may be though that without the combination of forces at work this wouldn't have been as good as it turned out to be. Not terrific. I'm not saying that, but it's a good film.Of note: Will Smith's acting in this is pretty damn good. His character's tend to be extensions of Fresh Prince. They're highly exuberant and cocky. This time, he's subdued and a bit more cynical. It's a nice change. Let's see... There's the presence of James Cromwell, which helps any film. And here's something: I noticed that many of the characters in the film are black. I appreciated seeing this since these characters are not by necessity black characters, they're just people and these are black. That kind of racial mix made sense to me and I feel it needs to be done a lot more often.Anyway, it's not dull, it's not silly and it's got something to say. I think you might give it a try.

title: Pure entertainment
content: I tend to be a purist at times, but in this case I decided to let things go, since I don't remember reading Asimov's book because my sci-fi reading phase was decades ago. So I sat back and enjoyed. It delivered. I was pleased with the visual effects combined with attention to detail.The movie was made before the advent of smart phones, but I thought they could have anticipated them, since people already had cell phones. Small thing. Del's (Will's) car was nice.As a fan of Blue Bloods, I was a little distracted by Bridget Moynihan's presence but that is on me since I watched the movie 20 years after it was made. 20 years! So hard to believe.

title: Cringe at times
content: Will Smith is a great actor but this film just didn't suit him. I couldn't take it seriously at all. Independence day was the exception!

title: Robotic feature
content: This movie start with a police officer who was a police of robots. They was a certain robot which could not follow orders and had gone rogue. The humans where forced to interact with the robots to report their crimes and it became a robotic evolution. The humans had inverted over a thousand robots and then the robots where tested and the put to use this made the people aware and able to stay with the robots. Every individual during this cast was very comfortable with the robots hence they had freedom to walk in the city and complete their duties. The ideology of this movie is mainly focused on the new technologies.

title: I really liked this movie.
content: Although the story did not follow that of Sir Asimov's original stories, the premise and ideology was intact.I particularly liked how the story kept you on edge, not knowing for sure if "Sonny" was with or against Will Smith's character. And I thought Mr. Smith played his part very well, one of his best portrayals.I also liked the special effects, very realistic, quite authentic. The CGI was well blended into the 'real' imagery to the extent that I gave up looking for the flaws and simply accepted and appreciated the high quality provided for my viewing pleasure. And indeed it was.I do not go many movies more than once, this one will be one of the few exceptions.

title: Read
content: This is a must see film. It was a great, kept you watching till the end. Unpredictable. Real action. ALL AROUND GREAT FILM AND CAST. If you are going to see one film this summer make it I,Robot. You cant go wrong. The cast was perfect for the role. Will was outstanding. This film would not have been the same had it not been for Wills' acting ability and humor. Haven't seen a film this year with such great F/X. Everything in this film was flowing nothing out of order. Don't miss this film. If you like SicFi this is one film that will make you love it you will be amazed by the lifelikeness of the robots. More than that you will also want one for yourself. If you want to take your family to see a good movie this is it. It is good for all ages.

title: Surprisingly good and entertaining.
content: I'll admit that I was never to excited about seeing this movie. The trailers and advertising campaign didn't impressed me and the movie to me seemed like a overblown action/science-fiction blockbusters. I'm glad I watched it nevertheless, the movie wasn't exactly subtle or deep but it certainly was entertaining and had a solid story.Yes, this movie truly is solid entertainment. It has some good and original action sequences and the special effects are superb. Especially the robots look both splendid and impressive and are a perfect mixture of an humane and a robot-look. Also the sets and the movie its futuristic look deserve credit in this movie.Let's face is, Will Smith isn't as hot as an actor as he used to be. Yes, sure he still makes box offices successes like "Hitch" but he is not the action movie star that he used to be in the '90's. With "I, Robot" Smith however still shows that he has still got it in him and he portrays a likable main action hero character and also manages to put some humor in some of the scene's. Bridget Moynahan however wasn't a great casting choice, yes she has played in quite some successful movies already but I'm convinced of it that this is an actress that will be totally forgotten in about ten years from now. She doesn't make a lasting impression in this movie and the other movies I have seen her in.The movie could had been just as deep and thought-provoking as for instance the other science-fiction movie, that shows some parallels with this movie, "Minority Report" but this movie chooses to be entertaining instead. And in entertaining it does not fail. The movie is both spectacular and tense to watch, which is also thanks to the plot twists in the movie. It all makes "I, Robot" a science-fiction/action spectacle that I put now on the list, as one of the must sees of 2004.8/10http://bobafett1138.blogspot.com/

title: Great sci-fi and even better CGI
content: Sometime in the 21st century robots have become integrated into regular society. Their role is to help humans and basically act as servants. They have 3 strict rules that prevent them from going haywire. As the robots become more and more complex so does the program that helps control them and after a murder of one of the top robot designers is committed, supposedly by a robot, questions about what is really going on arise...I have never read the book by Isaac Asimov, but I will bet that it delves much deeper into the philosophy of robots, humans, and their differences. However, as far Hollywood scripting goes, this is really good material, especially since it is an adaptation which Hollywood tends to mess up or be extremely liberal with, and as a result much of the original story is lost (*cough* Troy *cough*). The performances are also very good especially from Sonny the robot, who gives robots a touching side, but the undisputed star here is the one and only Mr. CGI.ABSOLUTELY, POSITIVELY, AMAZINGLY JAW-DROPPING COMPUTER EFFECTS. Each action scene is flat-out great. And just wait until you get to the finale: ASTOUNDING. All in the fluid camera work and terrific animation. Alex Proyas' visionary direction is also great and world he creates almost reminds you of Lucas' Star Wars landscapes in the first 3 episodes. So, if this is the future of Hollywood sci-fi then I must say: Bring it on. 8/10Rated PG-13: action/violence, and some profanity

title: i robot - aye.
content: This flick was not the greatest sci-fi of all time, but it is far from the worst. It will keep you captivated from start to finish.Lotsa kudos to the special effects people. Did you check the credits? Twice the population of Rhode Island.I agree with the word-y critic. The tunnel scene was magnificent - robots flying about, and Smith getting knocked about. Any mortal human would have been killed but, Smith is not a mortal. He seems to be in every third movie which is fine with me. The two he made with his on were beauts."I Robot" has the premise that, eventually, we will all have robots cleaning our homes and pools, obeying our every whim. Neat - as long as they continue to be subservient.A book with a somewhat similar theme is "The Children's War" by J. N. Stroyan - even more frightening as it describes life in Europe following a Nazy victory. The common people are treated like robots. It should be a must read. It is not a quick read - it is 1,150 pages.Back to the robotical goings-on. It is exciting science fiction, a biiig budgeter that has rightfully earned its bucks. "The Prince of Bel-Air" is the king of Hollywood.

title: Good film, surpassed expectations
content: I was extensively warned about this film by people telling me how bad it was, thus i watched it with very low expectations. However when i did get round to watching it i found it a very well made movie. This film is not "Shawshank Redemption" or Citizen Cane but it does not try to be, and that is a good thing. "I Robot" is simply a fun and enjoyable action movie with just the right amount of seriousness. Unlike A.I. which is completely over dramatic and sentimental, and most modern blockbusters, this gets the balance right. It is not a flawless movie, there are some Hollywood clichés and Will Smith is sometimes undecided in how to play his role. However the action is entertaining and the plot not completely predictable, which cannot be said for most blockbusters nowadays. Overall if you want a good watchable action film that wont make your brain completely switch off then i recommend it.

title: Very Enjoyable
content: I just watched this for the second time last night with my dad as I brought it on Blu Ray which as got the best picture and sound quality I have seen on a blu ray thus far.The film is gripping from the beginning right through until the end, the story features action, emotion and a slight romance from time to time which targets all audiences which may watch this film.If you are looking for a good movie which can entertain for all then this is your movie. A UK rating 15 film does not feature much blood or swearing so may be suitable for younger teenagers alike.If you haven't seen this film yet then go and rent it and watch and enjoy as I know I certainly did.

title: Laughably unsuitable character for Will Smith. Fake & lame, but adequate TV-level entertainment
content: Will Smith got an unfortunate rep a few years back as the "King of Summer Blockbusters," or the "King of July," or some such. It was entirely coincidental to his adequate talent that the summer release movies he was in happened to be blockbusters, and happened to make a ton of money. "Independence Day" and "Men in Black" were great, and loads of fun. Let's be honest, though--- they would have worked equally well with or without Will Smith. That's not to say he isn't charming. He does, indeed, have a kind of talent. But to saddle him, at that time a green and novice actor, with somehow having the "magic touch" turning ordinary fare into blockbuster magic was unfair. It raised the expectations of his abilities far beyond reality, and far beyond his ability to actually deliver."I, Robot" is just OK. The robots and the general sci-fi environment were, at all, times, laden with the paper-thin, two-dimensional vibe of a dim CARTOON!!! There were a few bright spots, such as the tunnel scene where the giant robot-hauling vans overtook Smith's cartoonmobile. But his acting job here, trying in vain to capture the cliche of the ironic, world-weary, been-everywhere, seen-it-all street cop, was so fake and unsuited to Smith that it was almost entertaining for its laughability.So, see "I, Robot," if at all, with a attitude expecting light, superficial, quickly forgettable "TV" quality fare. I gave it 5 out of 10, and that was fair and generous.

title: Great film!
content: this film is fantastic. i love robot movies (A.I. is also one of my favourite movies) but even if you don't, there's more here than just robots. will smith is awesome, and he really holds the film together. the CGI effects are smooth, and the robots look great. sonny is a really good character, and helps us to identify with other characters, esp. the other robots. the camera work is fantastic, especially in the climax. i thought the cast was well chosen, and it was good to see Shia doing something so different from Holes. i was worried in case the film dialogue might be a bit corny, but it wasn't. will smith had some really funny lines, as did his grandma. the plot was explained well, so you knew the whole time what was going on. it is an incredible film. go see.

title: An sci-fi movie that explores philosophical concepts
content: I-Robot might easily be one of the very few science-fiction works that succeed a combination of both action and philosophy. It is incredible in making great use of a futuristic metallic look and heavy action scenes that illustrates some topics which are increasingly relevant today: what really makes humanity and to what extent can we really trust the technology we've created?Probably the really strong point for the movie is the atmosphere. This movie creates a world that is both near-future and somehow ageless. The cold metallic surrounds and the neat robotic designs are suggestive of a society that can learn to live quite, perhaps too, well with its advances in technology. And yet beneath all of that glistening beauty, somehow is a touch of something creepy, a warning that progress has its price.

title: Will Smith,future great saving-people-and-robot cop
content: I just watched this movie 5 minutes ago.Actually,it's not so bad.Will Smith is one of my favourite actor,so,in this movie,I wanna not just about the high technology,but some different Will.He showed me still a fun guy,saying funny words,smiling,cool,sometimes feels like a Raper:-).And the pretty girl disappointed me--Bridget Moynahan,likes a super model,slim,beautiful,tall,and nothing more.She is just a character for Will to save.Sonny is the better part.He has a really actor to play the voice!!Alan Tudyk,I think he has a same face of Sonny--lovely with round eyes.I like this scene when he winked to Will--Will said it means trust.Still,this is a movie for killing time,and it does.Ennnn....how to say,we just want to relax,it gives.Though I hate a story about a HERO saves our EARTH again...when things can just be done on the great screen...I think ticket is worthing......

title: Watched this again last night - great movie
content: I'm somewhat surprised that this movie is only a 7.1. Compared to many of today's more highly rated movies, I Robot has a much better story and better acting. Thoroughly enjoyed it despite having seen it several times.

title: Excellent film that beautifies the human spirit
content: I was expecting this to be just a really cool action film with awesome special effects, but this film has plenty more to offer. It's an extremely interesting movie that, apart from clearly illustrating how man cannot depend solely on machines, explores the definition of life. Sunny, an MS-5, had been programmed to have emotions. Why would anyone want a robot to have emotions? How can this robot be beneficial to society? Another interesting question that arises is does Sunny have a soul? Does he deserve to be treated with as much respect as any another human being? The movie does a great job of answering all these questions. The central theme of the movie is that machine can never replace man.

title: Nice little movie about robots going on an insane rampage.
content: My first thought when watching this film was, "Wow, Alex Proyas discovered that there is an entire spectrum of colors outside of red and black!"Beyond that, I thought it was a fine film. As part of a new generation of intelligent sci-fi (spurred by films like The Matrix and Minority Report), it does well. As an action movie, it succeeds with flying colors (and lots of them). Will Smith is a hit-or-miss sort of an actor, but he (and his Danzig-esque pecs) did well this time. The others did a competent job as well.In a nutshell, the story is this: Will Smith is a cop in the near future, who's paranoid about robots (and who could blame him? they're scary-ass-scary). They're being mass-produced, and are as common as any home appliance. After a prominent scientist apparently commits suicide, Smith's character suspects something has gone awry with the programming of a new line of robots about to be released on the market. The catch is, the problem must be far more complicated than one machine simply going haywire, since all robots adhere to the three laws of robotics (outlined by Isaac Asimov, and you'll hear them several times throughout the film).The special effects, particularly the CG characters, were excellently done. The robot characters were seamlessly animated and had a sense of real physical weight, and there was never a sense of fakeness when they interacted with a flesh-and-blood actor (Alex Proyas owes a huge debt in this respect to Peter Jackson and George Lucas). The musical score by Marco Beltrami was workmanlike... adequate, but nothing especially memorable.One aspect of the film that I did find gripeworthy was that, despite the intelligence of the subject matter, it stuck hard and fast to the 120 minute action film formula. For most of the way through, it was unnoticeable, but maybe 3/4 of the way through the seams began to show. When predictability ensues during a fast-paced thriller, the director is doing something wrong. Thankfully, it's only a minor flaw in this case.All in all, a fine film. Likely the best the summer season has to offer. 3.5/4 stars.

title: Action flick dreck
content: Isaac Asimov rolls in his grave as yet another sci-fi classic is turned into Hollywood action flick dreck. Are there any smart science fiction films any more? Most films in this genre tend to be more action than science fiction. This film is guilty in that case as there are more action sequences than dialogue and when there is dialogue it's just there to move the plot along to the next action sequence. Oddly enough the credits at the end read "Suggested by Isaac Asimov" instead of "based on the book by". How many times in film have we seen one character who tells everyone else that they're in mortal danger and they never believe him until it's almost too late? We know what's going to happen. This film could have been an interesting metaphor for American xenophobia but instead is another crass summer action flick. Not surprisingly the same writing team went on to make "I Am Legend" with Will Smith which also butchered the novella.

title: i loved it!
content: I initially saw a little clip of this movie on an Australian talk show and thought the special effects looked really lame so I thought I'd give it a miss. Luckily this was the only movie running at the only time I had to see one, and overall I really loved it!! Will Smith plays Detective Spooner, a guy who's past affects his judgement about the present and the future, in particular robots. When a scientist appears to have committed suicide, he begins to uncover something more serious going on with the robots and the ppl around him. Bridget Moynahan plays Dr Susan Calvin, a psychiatrist who hides behind big words and robots to prevent her emotions being let out. Once Susan meets Det Spooner, she's not intrigued by him but the mystery in general. I loved the robot Sonny, if only we could really only someone like him :)I give this movie an 8/10 and recommend this to any sci-fi fans out there

title: Thrilling sci-fi action film
content: Will Smith, in his usual role as the good guy armed with a gun, is taking on a new type of monster for I, Robot: robots. A renowned scientist is dead and his death rests upon the conscience of Del Spooner (Will Smith), who is totally convinced a robot committed the act because of his prejudice against robots.The robot he believe did it is Sonny, a robot that is more human than machine. We discover this in his second confrontation with Spooner where Spooner questions him. This scene, like the first one with Sonny and Del, are quite effective and both remain highlights throughout the film. Sonny is the best one in the film, providing emotion but remaining intimidating in his first scenes. And when that intimidation needs to be his removed, his voice actor does a fabulous job.Bridget Monahayan is the character who works alongside him but clearly despises him. She has a great role and pulls it off well, so I'm surprised I've never seen her in another film. Thnakfully, the cliché of the two liking each other is non-existent. They work side by side, uncovering a great robot conspiracy and try to stop it as it unfolds in an exhilarating showdown.The last 20 minutes are all action, and probably some of my favorite sci-fi action sequences. My favorite in the film, though, is when robots attack Spooner in a 10-star scene that will remain timeless in my collection of sci-fi films.All the movies action sequences are memorable as well as the emotional side that fills the gaps between action sequences. Everything is pulled off well, although Will Smith is sadly a bit dry until he reveals why he is so biased against robots.The mystery that unveils a conspiracy has its share of twists that, while not being complex, are certainly not clichéd and even a bit surprising. This makes the movie all the more better. I'm surprised the movie has only a 7.0, it's a fun film you will not soon forget. 7.8/10.

title: I, Liked it
content: A thoughtful and intelligent action movie.I liked it, I really liked it. If you walk in expecting a true-to-Asimov experience, you will be disappointed. But if you walk in afraid they will have slaughtered it, you'll be as pleasantly surprised as I was.An exceptionally clear path through this one, fast-paced without being frenetic, elaborate without being ostentatious, CG without being obvious. Close to the chest, believable, realistic, and very funny too, without being over-the-top comedic.I found 'the kid' to be a complete red herring, he's in the movie from start to finish but has utterly no meaning, he's tacked in there for demographics and at no time moves the story forward. Other than that, the film deserves to be called Science Fiction rather than Action/Fantasy, and the director's view of the future is lived-in, credible, and organic.No Jar-Jar syndrome either, the main robot Sonny is an astonishingly compelling person. I was quite taken with him.The robots in general, are amazing. That willing suspension of disbelief one so rarely becomes completely taken in by, they are amazingly animated, never seem like CG comic-book animation (sorry, Catwoman!), and at all times convey individuality and a very human aura. It's amazing, they better get an academy nod, they are so worth it.This whole film was SO worth it. I'm dying to go back and see it again.

title: The Robots Are Out To Get Us !
content: First of all i would like to say that i absolutely love Will Smith he is my most favourite actor. He totally makes this film what it is with the way he says his lines and the bits he adds in. This film is also my favourite film of all time (along with The Princess Bride) because it is fabulous. Will Smith plays a Chicago Detective in 2035 where robots take over our daily chores and it all seems too good to be true. The thing is, it was, and only one person saw it coming. When Det. Spooner (Will Smith) finds out the maker of these robots has committed suicide he begins to suspect something more... As I have already said this is definitely the film to see if you like Sci - Fi that is, well I wouldn't even class it as that anyway ! Thanks IMDb x x

title: Much Better Than I Expected
content: When I first heard of the film, I thought it was going to be simply a programmer with great special effects and non-stop action. As it turns out, I, ROBOT does have the requisite action and special effects, but it also has a story with something to say about the world.Will Smith stars as Del Spooner, a cop who has a big issue with robots, which have become enormously popular in 2030s America. His suspicions of them are in complete contrast to most other people, who think they are a great help to society.When the inventor of these robots dies, Spooner thinks he was murdered by one of his creations, while everyone else believes it to be a suicide. What follows is a roller-coaster side of twists and turns as the film drives toward an unexpected conclusion.What could have been simply a generic action picture, turns into something much more. I, ROBOT will entertainment, but it will also ask you think as well. Hopefully, it will inspire other producers to do the same with their big action films.

title: Brilliant SFX...Even Though It's Not As Close To The Books As It Could Have Been....
content: Am a huge fan of the Asimov books and when I heard that a movie was to be made from the stories, I counted down the days until its release.Was disappointed at the liberties the film took with Asimov's "Three Laws" and found myself screaming that "No way would the robots do that if they were really Three Laws True." However, I found myself enjoying the movie for what it was....a summer blockbuster.I am not a huge fan of Will Smith as he seems to continually play the same role however I did enjoy him in this film. His interaction with Sonny the Robot (Alan Tudyk) was interesting and watching their relationship develop, along with the relationship between Spooner and Susan Calvin was interesting.Sonny the Robot was truly amazing...The CGI used to create him was nothing short of breathtaking and the emotion that Tudyk gave him made me feel sorry for his predicament. I found that I was wanting to see more of him on-screen than the other characters!! On the whole, while this film may not be as true to the books as the "Asimovians" (fans of Doctor Asimov's work) such as myself would have liked, it was still enjoyable. In my younger brother's words..."Leave your brain at the door and don't think about it too much."RATING: 9/10

title: Great movie taken from 1951 book
content: I lived this movie thinking it was a original story but was actually from Issac Asimov's 1951 book I, robot .. but it still makes a great movie

title: I can't understand all the negative reviews on here
content: As far as summer blockbusters go, I,Robot delivers in spades. Charismatic hero? Check. Seamless CGI? Check. Superb action? Check. Plot? Check. Granted, Will Smith's career needed a hit but this is it. He is not in Bad Boys/ID4 wisecracking mode and his tone does not take away from the brain that this blockbuster is desperately trying to express.The film is based on Sci-fi writer Isaac Asimov's story set in Chicago in the year 2035 when robots have been fully integrated into society, occupying the positions of trusted servant and menial worker. There are 3 laws of robotics that are 'perfect' in that robots may not allow a human to come to harm. However, when a top scientist from the US Robotics corporation turns up dead, Smith's character suspects the involvement of a prototype that may not be bound by the 3lawsIf you want to be thoroughly entertained whilst still enthralled for 2 hours go see the 2nd best film of the summer after Spideman2.

title: iRobot, a tale of technology and where the future of robotics could be headed
content: I've watched this movie many years ago. As a Will Smith and sci-fi fan, I was excited at the prospect of seeing Will do his running man as he usually does in Action Movies. The most exciting thing about watching this movie again, many years later, is that it hardly seems far fetched any longer.We may not have had these at the time of the movie release in 2004, but we certainly have progress with technology since. We now have:flat screens and monitors that are touch screen - Audi R8, available commercially - scanning ID activators - robots who help you around the home - blue tooth ear piecesAs for Will Smith, the acting is superb as always. The story line which refers to the laws of robotics seems as if it is law to override all laws. The cinematography and action scenes are realistic and believable. If you have not seen this movie, it is every sci-fi lovers dream. Catch it on Blu-Ray for an even closer experience.

title: I, Robot
content: I, Robot is a unique movie with amorous objects like within scientific fiction. I, Robot is the ultimate escape plan from the kingdom of man into machine. Fire and shotgun bullets are dangerous combined elementally like with it's own gun powder in the chamber. Bullets are used and we are transported into "I, Robot."

title: This movie is great
content: Dont be rude and mean, this movie is super awesome

title: This is what fun summer movies are about.
content: No matter how good a movie is, there will always be someone who finds fault with some aspect of it. Sometimes, it's the differences between the book and the movie and often, the star of the movie alone will foster enough negative reaction as to dissuade viewers from even giving the film a chance. For this flick to garner as much negative reaction as it has, I believe this the case.This movie had so much to like. The mystery unfolded at a pace that kept me entertained from beginning to end. The action scenes were just right as far as frequency and intensity. Will Smith's comedic element kept the movie from being too dark (ala Dark City), while still not being a MIB-type comedy fest.Most of the effects were on a level as to easily make one forget they weren't real. There were new futuristic concepts that were done well and made sense, like parking a car for instance. Sonny, the lead robotic character, pulled many emotions from the audience due to his realistic portrayal.Was it perfect? Of course not. Plot holes, impossible physics, script anomalies, and other things that the movie's detractors have endlessly mentioned do exist. Did they subtract enough from an otherwise good film. Not in my opinion.All in all, this was a good, fun summer flick. Unlike any film I've seen for years, I plan to see this again in the theater. 8/10

title: It is a better movie than I had expected...
content: I never comment on movies that I think are bad because if you can't say anything nice then don't say anything at all.Quite a few people have complained about this movie, they find factual flaws, I mean, come on what do you expect? Someone actually commented that Chicago will not be as advanced by 2035 and that is a flaw. Hello? This is a movie about robots that are super intelligent and super fast and super strong and very agile. Is that anywhere close to our reality? No, wake up, it's a movie, not reality! It's suppose to be fun to watch and I think people should watch it. Don't expect any great message to be sent to you which will open up your minds and you will end up being a better person. It's entertainment. You want to enlighten yourself, go read a book, something serious, maybe a classic.Here's what this movie also had that you probably don't see in the trailer cause the trailer shows you that it's got LOTS OF action, which it does, but it's also got suspense elements and some good comedy. The suspense in this movie is well done, you actually become interested in knowing who the culprit is and you don't get bored. On top of that, it's funny, Will Smith is a very sharp and witty guy, he always plays the sharp and witty guy, and it's fun to watch him be the sharp and witty guy. Plus we have a very small part played by Shia Lebeouf, the kid from Even Stevens, he delivers lines really well. I wish he had more time on screen with Will, they were really funny together. On top of all of this, obviously, it's got action. I mean tell me one person that will look away when you see this Will Smith in his futuristic AUDI driving in a tunnel at amazingly high speed with 5 robots trying to kill him. Even people who complained about it as being bad action didn't look away so I am sure you won't find it dull and boring either. And everything is well paced, it's not like the movie slows down. You see some action, then you see something serious, something emotional and then something funny and then you're back to some more action. There is no dull or boring period in the movie, which makes it fun to watch.People stop complaining about this movie. It's a better movie than I had expected. I like it and I am almost sure you will too if all you want to do is go have a good time watching a good movie.

title: A Great Sci-Fi Film Though only Will Smith Leads The Charge
content: Watched I,Robot Featured an Amazing Performance from a Stellar Lead Will Smith(Indpendence Day) as Del Spooner . Also Featuring Bridget Moynahan(Serendipity)as Susan Calvin,Alan Tudyk(Firefly) as Beth Sonny .Bruce Greenwood(Thirteen Days) as Lawrence Robertson , James Cromwell(Star Trek: First Contact) as Dr.Alfred Lanning,Chi McBride(Gone In 60 Seconds) as John Bergin, Shia LaBeouf(Holes) as Farber, and Fiona Hogan(Dark Angel) as VIKI , The Film was brilliant also the villain is not who you think it is a thriller and mystery laced with Sci-Fi Elements and all the characters were fantastic though an always great performance from Wil Smith .amazing From Production Design from Patrick Tatopoulos(Battlefield Earth) , Costume design from Liz Keogh(The Dark Room), Musical Score from Marco Beltrami(Terminator 3:Rise Of The Machines) ,Screenplay By Akiva Goldsman(A Beautiful Mind) and Direction from Alex Proyas(Dark City ) A Great Sci-Fi Film Though only Will Smith Leads The Charge 8/10

title: Surprisingly Excellent
content: So okay its quite obviously a bit of a loose translation of Asimov's short stories to the big screen. That aside I,Robot is a killer movie in its own right. The writer included many themes and similar moments from the stories into the movie and sorta blended all of the stories together. The action in the climax of this movie is unbelievable with whirling camera angles and seamless cg/live action sequences which will have you holding your breath for what feels like a year. The voice acting for the hero Sunny is very moving and enjoyable and the cg for the robots is PERFECTLY realistic. Will Smith does a great job of playing the humorous/sexy/hard core action hero. He delivers his comedy with great timing and expression and the action with a heavy hand(you'll see what i mean;). Also I'm rather glad that the writer did not cheapen the experience by having hero kiss heroine in the end of the movie. It would have detracted from the movie to throw in a love story in the midst of an already great movie. All in all kickass; go see it!

title: Not another Men In Black; this film had depth
content: I felt I, Robot was a very enjoyable film. From the title I didn't want to see the film. But after watching the trailer with "Sonny's" exclamation that he did not kill his inventor I made a point to see it the next day. I recommend this film to anyone who appreciates good Si-Fi/Action films and killer special effects/CGI.Based on the trailer (and and some of Will Smith's other movies) I went into the theater expecting a good show, but a poor plot with no twists. I was wrong. I felt the storyline had good depth and was engaging throughout the film. I was engrossed!IMHO this is Smith's best movie to date (with the Bad Boys series trailing). Proyas (the director) did a very fine job on this film. I give it two robotic thumbs up!!!

title: Well worth seeing
content: I put off seeing this one for ages because of the bad critical reviews. But this one surprised me, it sure was a kick ass movie. I found it intelligent, absorbing and enjoyable. Also there was no sex which is also a major bonus. I thought it was Will Smith's best so far (even considering his excellent portrayal of that boxer, uh what was his name!). Anyway I think the critics in general got this one wrong. This was a much better movie than Spiderman 2, and deserved to do better at the box office. Although the future is most unlikely to look anything like what was shown here, the questions thrown up regarding robots and artificial intelligence are certainly thought provoking.
